eu.cqse.check.framework.shallowparser.languages.base

Class LineBasedStatementRecognizerBase<STATE extends java.lang.Enum<STATE>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.shallowparser.framework.RecognizerBase<STATE>
      • eu.cqse.check.framework.shallowparser.languages.base.LineBasedStatementRecognizerBase<STATE>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PythonSimpleStatementRecognizer

    public abstract class LineBasedStatementRecognizerBase<STATE extends java.lang.Enum<STATE>>
extends RecognizerBase<STATE>
    Base class for recognizing statements in a language whose statements are primarily line-based. It also assumes that a semicolon may always be used to terminate a statement.

    • Constructor Detail

        public LineBasedStatementRecognizerBase()
        Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • registerNestingMatch

        protected void registerNestingMatch(ETokenType opening,
                                    ETokenType closing)
        Registers nesting tokens (e.g. braces). When the recognizer is going through a statement it will check if the current token is of a type registered with this method.

      • isNestedClosingToken

        protected boolean isNestedClosingToken(ETokenType token)
        Check whether the given token is a type of closing token for tokens which might be nested in a statement.

        For example `)` would return true in `a = new ArrayList();`.

      • matchesLocally

        protected int matchesLocally(ParserState<STATE> parserState,
                             java.util.List<IToken> tokens,
                             int startOffset)
        Attempts to match the recognizer locally (without respecting tail recognizers).
        Overrides:
        matchesLocally in class RecognizerBase<STATE extends java.lang.Enum<STATE>>
        Parameters:
        parserState - the current state of the underlying parser.
        tokens - the list of tokens.
        startOffset - the current offset into the tokens from where to start matching.
        Returns:
        the new offset (position right behind the match) or RecognizerBase.NO_MATCH if matching was not possible at this position.

      • getEntityType

        protected EShallowEntityType getEntityType()
        Returns:
        The entity type that is to be created when matching.

      • getEntitySubtypeName

        protected java.lang.String getEntitySubtypeName()
        Returns:
        The entity subtype name to be used when creating a node.

      • getEntityName

        protected java.lang.String getEntityName(java.util.List<IToken> tokens,
                                         int startOffset)
        Returns:
        The name used for the created entity node. Default implementation uses the text of the first token (the token at position startOffset).

      • getSubParseState

        protected abstract STATE getSubParseState()
        Returns the state to be used for a sub parse.

      • tokenStartsSubParse

        protected abstract boolean tokenStartsSubParse(ETokenType tokenType,
                                               java.util.List<IToken> tokens,
                                               int offset,
                                               java.util.Stack<ETokenType> expectedClosing)
        Returns true if the token signals to start a sub parse (e.g. embedded classes, functions, etc.).
        Parameters:
        tokenType - the type of the current token.
        tokens - the entire token stream.
        offset - the offset of the current token in the token stream.
        expectedClosing - the stack of currently expected closing delimiters

      • startsNewStatement

        protected abstract boolean startsNewStatement(IToken token,
                                              IToken lastToken)
        Returns true if the given token starts a new statement.
